optionalfeature.name: Diamond Dust
entries: When you take the Dragonborn Breath Weapon action, you can expend one superioty die to increse its range and damage. The range of the Breath Weapon is doubled and every damage dice turns into the superioty die used. Example: if your Breath Weapon normally deals {@dice 4d6} damage, has 15 ft. cone range and the expended superiority die is a d10, when you use this maneuver, the Breath Weapon would instead deal {@dice 4d10} damage and have 30 ft. cone range.

optionalfeature.name: Spectral Wings
entries: When you fall from any height, you can expend your superiority die and use your reaction to protect yourself from any fall damage. When you do so, your falling rate becomes 60 ft per round until you land. The first time you hit a creature with an attack before landing, you can add your superiority die to the damage.

feat.name: Silver Soul

prerequisite.other: Requires the blessing of Argynvost, a Breath Weapon and a superiority die

entries: Part of Argynvost's spirit now resides within you, making it possible to for you to use an extent of his power for a short period of time. You learn the following Battlemaster maneuvers:

items: {@optfeature Diamond Dust|Zordnael|Diamond Dust}. When you take the Dragonborn Breath Weapon action, you can expend one superioty die to increse its range and damage. The range of the Breath Weapon is doubled and every damage dice turns into the superioty die used. Example: if your Breath Weapon normally deals {@dice 4d6} damage, has 15 ft. cone range and the expended superiority die is a d10, when you use this maneuver, the Breath Weapon would instead deal {@dice 4d10} damage and have 30 ft. cone range.

{@optfeature Spectral Wings|Zordnael|Spectral Wings}. When you fall from any height, you can expend your superiority die and use your reaction to protect yourself from any fall damage. When you do so, your falling rate becomes 60 ft per round until you land. The first time you hit a creature with an attack before landing, you can add your superiority die to the damage.

feat.name: Elven Wisdom
entries: The centuries of life experienced by elves makes perfection out of practice. You have a trained muscular, sensory and long-term memory that supports you in multiples activities that you are trained on. You gain the following benefits:

items: Whenever you have advantage on an ability check using Dexterity, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, you can reroll one of the dice once.

feat.name: Star of Ice and Hate

prerequisite.other: Requires a fragment of Delban's soul

entries: The fragment Delban's divine soul that resides within has awaken. Because of that, your affinity with cold becomes clear. When you gain this feat, you gain the following benefits:

items: Spells you cast ignore resistance to the cold damage.
When you roll damage for a spell you cast that deals cold damage, you can treat any 1 on a damage die as a 2.
When you cast a spell that deals acid, fire, lightning or thunder damage, you can spend 1 sorcery point to change that damage type to cold.

entries: This feat can stack with the {@feat Elemental Adept|phb|Elemental Adept} feat. If you take that feat choosing the cold element, treat immunity to cold as resistance to cold instead and you can also treat any 1 or 2 rolled on a damage die of a cold damage spell as a 3.

feat.name: Vistana's Heritage
entries: The blood of a Vistana is a powerful, and so are their words. When you gain this feat, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your Charisma score maximum is increased by 2.

You can utter a curse and cast the {@spell bestow curse} spell at 5th level on a creature you can see once per long rest without expending a spell slot. When you do so, you can cast it with a 30ft range, do not need somatic components and the uttered curse works as the verbal component of the spell. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for that spell.

feat.name: Dusk Elf Princess
entries: The Dusk Elves lived in the lands of Barovia long before it was invaded by Strahd. The tribe has battled the Children of Mother Night for centuries. Those of the royal bloodline have developed a way to fight them, and their wisdom is passed down generations through memories reached by meditation. When you gain this feat, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your Wisdom score maximum is increased by 2.

You can reach out to your royal blood power and cast the {@spell moonbeam} spell at the level up to your proficiency bonus without spending a spell slot once per long rest. When you do so, the spell does not require concentration. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for that spell.

trait.name: Telepathic Bond (Succubus/Incubus)
entries: The baast ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature it has {@condition charmed}. The two don't even need to be on the same plane of existence.

trait.name: Shapechanger (Succubus/Incubus)
entries: The baast can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Without wings, the baast loses its flying speed. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Claw (Fiend Form only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Whip of Submission
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d4 + 6}) slashing damage, or 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Charm
entries: One humanoid the fiend can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} for 1 day. The {@condition charmed} target obeys the fiend's verbal or telepathic commands. If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this fiend's Charm for the next 24 hours.
The fiend can have only one target {@condition charmed} at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

action.name: Draining Kiss
entries: The fiend kisses a creature {@condition charmed} by it or a willing creature. The target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 72 ({@damage 12d10 + 6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The fiend magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

legendary.name: Assault of Submission (Costs 2 actions)
entries: Baast attacks with his Whip of Submission or uses his Charm.

legendary.name: Currupting Guidance
entries: Baast targets one creature {@condition charmed} by him that is within 60 feet of him; that {@condition charmed} target must make a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, Baast decides how the target acts during its next turn.

Succubi and incubi inhabit all of the Lower Planes, and the lascivious dark-winged fiends can be found in service to devils, demons, night hags, rakshasas, and yugoloths. Asmodeus, ruler of the Nine Hells, uses these fiends to tempt mortals to perform evil acts. The demon lord Graz'zt keeps succubi and incubi as advisers and consorts.

Though legend speaks of them separately, any succubus can become an incubus, and vice versa. Most of these fiends do have a preference for one form or the other. Mortals only rarely see a succubus or incubus in its true form, however, for the fiend typically begins its corruption in veiled, insidious ways.

entries.name: Beautiful Corrupters
entries: A succubus or incubus first appears in ethereal form, passing through walls like a ghost to lurk next to a mortal's bedside and whisper forbidden pleasures. Sleeping victims are tempted to give in to their darkest desires, indulge in taboos, and feed forbidden appetites. As the fiend fills the victim's dreams with debauched images, the victim becomes more susceptible to temptation in everyday life.

Inevitably, the fiend enters the mortal realm in tempting form to directly influence a creature's actions. Appearing in the guise of a humanoid who has previously appeared only in the victim's dreams, the succubus or incubus seduces or befriends its victim, indulging all its desires so that it performs evil acts of its own free will.

A mortal bequeaths its soul to the fiend not by formal pledge or contract. Instead, when a succubus or incubus has corrupted a creature completely-some say by causing the victim to commit the three betrayals of thought, word, and deed-the victim's soul belongs to the fiend. The more virtuous the fiend's prey, the longer the corruption takes, but the more rewarding the downfall. After successfully corrupting a victim, the succubus or incubus kills it, and the tainted soul descends into the Lower Planes.

The succubus or incubus resorts to charming a victim magically only when necessary, usually as a form of self-defense. A charmed creature isn't responsible for its actions, so forcing it to behave against its will won't bring the fiend closer to the ultimate prize: the victim's soul.

entries.name: Deadly Kiss
entries: The kiss of a succubus or incubus is an echo of the emptiness that is the fiend's longing for a corrupted soul. Likewise, the recipient of the fiend's kiss gains no satisfaction from it, experiencing only pain and the profound emptiness that the fiend imparts. The kiss is nothing short of an attack, usually delivered as a final farewell before the fiend escapes.

Fiendish Offspring. Succubi and incubi can reproduce with one another to spawn more of their kind. Less commonly, a succubus or incubus reproduces with a humanoid. From this unholy union, a cambion child is conceived. Invariably, the fiendish offspring is as wicked as its fiendish parent.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The spy deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the spy that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the spy doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spy makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Charm of the Iron Tower (9/9)
entries: This charm has 9 charges. Ernest can use an action to expend 1 charge from the charm to gain 30 temporary hit points. For the next hour, his skin becomes gray, he smell like iron, and he has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing and fire damage.
Once all its charges have been expended, Ernest cannot make this action again.

Rulers, nobles, merchants, guildmasters, and other wealthy individuals use spies to gain the upper hand in a world of cutthroat politics. A spy is trained to secretly gather information. Loyal spies would rather die than divulge information that could compromise them or their employers.

item.name: Blood Bow of Kavan
entries: Kavan was a ruthless chieftain whose tribe lived in the Balinok Mountains centuries before the arrival of {@creature Strahd von Zarovich|CoS}. Although he was very much alive, Kavan had some traits in common with vampires: he slept during the day and hunted at night, he drank the blood of his prey, and he lived underground.

In battle, he wielded a spear stained with blood. This bow was once his blood spear, however, because of a ritual made to bond the spear with Soren, the spear transformed into a longbow. The longbow is a weapon that drains life from those it kills and is capable of shooting blood draining arrows.

This magic longbow has 3 charges. When you hit with a ranged attack using this magic longbow and reduce the target to 0 hit points, this bow regains one charge. It also replenishes all of its charges in a long rest.

The creature attuned to this bow can use one of its charges as part of an attack to imbue the arrow with necrotic energy, turning it into a blood draining arrow. If the attack hits, the target creature takes an additional {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage.

If the creature attuned with this bow makes a ranged attack with it while it has less than 3 charges, it cannot choose to not to make a non-lethal attack, since the bow is too thirsty for holding itself back.

Any creature can wield the bow, but only the character {@adventure chosen by Kavan|CoS|14|Blood Spear of Kavan} and attuned to it gains a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

item.name: Instrument of the Bards, Glamorous Violin
entries: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kind, superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take {@dice 2d4} psychic damage.

You can use an action to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be {@condition charmed} on a failed saving throw, thereby imposing disadvantage on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.
All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: {@spell fly}, {@spell invisibility}, {@spell levitate}, and {@spell protection from evil and good}.
In addition, the Glamorous Violin can be used to cast {@spell distort value}, {@spell enlarge/reduce}, and {@spell crown of madness}.
